result.execSummary:
The defendant Harold Sims was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: With any other sentence. With 5 days credit.

miscConds.notes:
*Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
*Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
*If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Provide a DNA sample.

*Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until  his civil rights are restored.

*No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
*No alcohol, No drugs.
*Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

*AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
*Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
*Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes:
*With Day Reporting Center and Huber for work. Court stayed commencement until 03/18/2016 by 5pm.

JOC is corrected to read With Day Reporting Center and Huber for work.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Harold Sims in court with attorney Christopher R Smith.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS with 5 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.  

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 7 MONTHS condition time with Day Reporting Center and Huber for work.  Court stayed commencement until 03/18/2016 by 5pm.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation if physician approved.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Harold Sims in court with attorney Christopher R Smith.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Harold Sims in court with attorney Christopher R Smith.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing, however additional discovery is needed, defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defense requests more time to obtain transcript from case 15CF2664.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Harold Sims in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to Suppress Proceeded. Court ordered witnesses sequestered.
Sworn for the State: Deputy Jamie Arnold and Detective Larrel Lirette, MCSD. COurt held colloquy with defendant as to right not to testify. Testimony closed.  Closing arguments made by the State and defense.  Based on all filings, testimony and evidence in court, the court DENIED defense motion to suppress. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse. Case adjourned to branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed, State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress.

Defendant Harold Sims in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Larrel Lirette, Deputy for Milwaukee County Sheriff.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of any illegal drugs.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
